intro: Palura chinensis var. pubescens, commonly known as the hairy Chinese palura, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves that are typically elliptical in shape. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by elliptical, woody fruits. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens for its foliage and unique growth habit.
